isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CUMMINS N14 ELECTRONIC ENGINE SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING - Service Brake and Clutch Switches

svcprocinfo.para: This test would be performed if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) displayed an incorrect switch position or Cummins diagnostic codes indicate a problem may be present.

entry.para: Disconnect clutch switch connector (294) from cab harness. With clutch pedal released, measure resistance between the pigtail terminals.
Check switch adjustment. Go to next step.

With clutch pedal depressed to the bottom of the free travel position (approx. 1.7 inches or 43 mm from pedal stop plate), the u-bolt plate should touch the switch actuator arm. When the clutch pedal returns to the stop, the switch should actuate (to closed position) with an audible click. Is clutch switch adjusted properly?
Replace and adjust clutch switch. Go to Step 1.
Adjust clutch switch. Go to Step 1.
Depress clutch pedal and measure resistance between clutch switch pigtail connector (294) terminals.
If switch is not properly adjusted, adjust and retest. If switch was properly adjusted, replace the switch.
Check clutch switch for short to gnd. With switch disconnected, measure resistance to gnd. at each switch terminal.
Clutch switch each pigtail to gnd.
Clutch switch checks good. Perform Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition.
Replace the clutch switch, then adjust.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition
svcsubproc.para: Perform Testing Clutch Switch before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (252), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test lead, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition

entry.para:
With clutch switch disconnected, remove ECM connector (252) from the ECM. Refer to Inspecting Navistar Engine Harness ECM Connector (252)
and inspect connector. ECM harness connector or ECM pins OK?

Replace harness connector terminals if damaged. If ECM pins are damaged, have Cummins dealer replace ECM. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.

Turn all CELECT cab switches to off or neutral position and set service brake using trailer hand valve. Use test leads and measure resistance to gnd. at connector (252) terminal 4 and 10 (circuit 97AH and 97-G).
Locate short to gnd. in circuit where resistance at terminal was less than 100K ohms, then repair.

With CELECT cab switches still in off or neutral position and service brake set, use test leads and measure resistance between terminals 4 and 10 (circuit 97AH and 97-G) and all other terminals in connector (252).
Locate short between circuits, then repair.
At connector (252), use test leads and measure voltage to gnd. at terminals 4 and 10 (circuit 97AH and 97-G).
The clutch switch circuits are free of short circuits. Perform Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for Continuity
Locate short to unwanted voltage source in circuit with more than 1.5 volts, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibrationto recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits For Continuity

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (252), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits For Continuity

entry.para: At ECM connector (252) use test lead to jumper terminal 4 (circuit 97AH) to ground. At clutch switch connector (294) measure resistance of 97AH to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AH between connectors (252) and (294), then repair.
At ECM connector (252) use test lead to jumper terminal 4 to 10 (circuit 97AH to 97-G). At clutch switch connector (294) measure resistance between circuits 97AH and 97-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GH, 97-GA or 97-G between connectors (252) and (294), then repair.
The clutch switch circuits and switch check good.
Remove connector (141) from brake switch. With brakes released, measure resistance across switch terminals. Switch should be closed.
Apply service brakes and measure resistance across the brake pressure switch. Switch should be open. NOTE: Sufficient air pressure must be present to apply service brakes for this test step.
Measure resistance to gnd. at both brake switch terminals with service brakes applied, and with brakes released. Both should be isolated from ground at all times.
Brake pressure switch both terminals to gnd.
Reconnect (141) to brake switch. Perform Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition

svcsubproc.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition
svcsubproc.para: Perform Testing Service Brake Switch (141) before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (252), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition

entry.para:
With connector (141) disconnected from brake switch, remove connector (252) from the ECM. Refer to Inspecting International Engine Harness ECM Connector (252)
to inspect connector. ECM connector and ECM pins OK?
Replace harness connector terminals if damaged. If ECM pins damaged, have Cummins dealer replace ECM.
Turn all CELECT cab switches to off or neutral position and disconnect clutch switch. Use test leads and measure resistance to gnd. at connector (252) terminals 13 and 10 (circuits 97AL and 97-G).
Locate short to ground. in circuit where resistance at terminal was less than 100K ohms, then repair.
Use test leads and measure resistance between terminal 13 and 10 (circuits 97AL and 97-G) and all other terminals in connector (252).
Locate short between any circuit where resistance between terminals is less than 100K ohms, then repair.
At connector (252), use test leads and measure voltage to ground at terminals 13 and 10 (circuits 97AL and 97-G).
The brake switch circuits are free of short circuits. Perform Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity.
Locate short to unwanted voltage source in circuit with more than 1.5 volts, then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (252), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity

entry.para: At ECM connector (252) use test lead to jumper terminal 13 (cir. 97L) to gnd. At brake switch connector (141) measure resistance to ground at circuit 97AL.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AL between connectors (252) and (141), then repair.
At ECM connector (252) use test lead to jumper terminal 13 to terminal 10 (circuits 97AL to 97-G). At brake switch connector (141) measure resistance between circuits 97AL and 97-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GF, 97-GA, or 97-G between connectors (252) and (141), then repair.
The service brake switch circuits and switch check good.
